name: Hack Saw
description: Hacksaws are used by plumbers to cut pipes and occasionally by electricians to cut conduit. The hacksaw got its name because historically these saws did not cut smoothly. They keep hacksaws on hand for jobs that need a more delicate touch.

name: Hammer
description: Hammers are used for a wide range of driving, shaping, breaking and non-destructive striking applications. Traditional disciplines include carpentry, blacksmithing, warfare, and percussive musicianship.

name: Electric Saw
description: In woodworking the term electric saw refers specifically to the hand-held type and the table saw and chop saw are other common forms of electric saws. Electric saw blades are specially designed for each particular material they are intended to cut.

name: Pliers
description: For bending wire and thin metal, round-nose pliers with tapering, conical jaws are used. Diagonal cutting pliers are used for cutting wire and small pins in areas that cannot be reached by larger cutting tools.

name: Glue Gun
description: For more substantial materials use a high temperature gun which operates at about 190Â°C. This type of glue gun is great for repairs around the house since the glue will bond ceramics, wood, plastics, and even many metals.

name: Measurement Tape
description: Tape measures are often designed for specific uses or trades. Measuring tapes designed for carpentry or construction often use a stiff, curved metallic ribbon that can remain stiff and straight when extended, but retracts into a coil for convenient storage.
